DB_IDbooks_1

Schema
# Table: books
[
(bookid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: book id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(title:VARCHAR(100), Comment: title of the book, Examples: [The Great Gatsby, A Brief History of Time]),
(author:VARCHAR(50), Comment: author of the book, Examples: [F. Scott Fitzgerald, Stephen Hawking]),
(publication_year:INTEGER, Comment: year of publication, Examples: [1925, 1988]),
(publisher:VARCHAR(50), Comment: publisher of the book, Examples: [Scribner, Bantam Books])
]

# Table: book_category
[
(bookid:INTEGER, Comment: book id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(categoryid:INTEGER, Comment: category id, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: categories
[
(categoryid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: category id, Examples: [1, 2]),
(categorytype:VARCHAR(20), Comment: type of category, Examples: [fiction, non-fiction])
]

Foreign keys
book_category.bookid=books.bookid
book_category.categoryid=categories.categoryid

question: What are the names of all employees who work in either the IT or HR department?
query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.name FROM employees AS T1 JOIN department AS T2 ON T1.empid = T2.empid JOIN departments AS T3 ON T3.deptid = T2.deptid WHERE T3.deptname = 'IT' OR T3.deptname = 'HR'
database:
# Table: employees
[
(empid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: employee id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(name:VARCHAR(50), Comment: employee name, Examples: [John Doe, Jane Smith]),
(age:INTEGER, Examples: [30, 25]),
(deptid:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: department
[
(empid:INTEGER, Comment: employee id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(deptid:INTEGER, Comment: department id, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: departments
[
(deptid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: department id, Examples: [1, 2]),
(deptname:VARCHAR(50), Comment: department name, Examples: [IT, HR]),
(location:VARCHAR(100), Comment: department location, Examples: [Building A, Building B])
]

# Foreign keys
department.empid=employees.empid
department.deptid=departments.deptid

question: Retrieve the last names of employees who have worked on both 'Project A' and 'Project B'.
query: select t1.lname from employee as t1 join works_on as t2 on t1.eid = t2.eid join projects as t3 on t3.projectid = t2.projectid where t3.projectname = 'Project A' intersect select t1.lname from employee as t1 join works_on as t2 on t1.eid = t2.eid join projects as t3 on t3.projectid = t2.projectid where t3.projectname = 'Project B'
database:
# Table: employee
[
(eid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: employee id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(lname:VARCHAR(12), Comment: last name, Examples: [Johnson, Wang]),
(fname:VARCHAR(12), Comment: first name, Examples: [Michael, Amy]),
(age:INTEGER, Examples: [28, 34]),
(department:INTEGER, Examples: [101, 102]),
(salary:REAL, Examples: [70000.00, 80000.00])
]

# Table: works_on
[
(eid:INTEGER, Comment: employee id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(projectid:INTEGER, Comment: project id, Examples: [10, 20])
]

# Table: projects
[
(projectid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: project id, Examples: [10, 20]),
(projectname:VARCHAR(50), Comment: project name, Examples: ['Project A', 'Project B']),
(start_date:DATE, Comment: project start date, Examples: ['2022-01-01', '2022-03-01']),
(end_date:DATE, Comment: project end date, Examples: ['2022-12-31', '2022-12-31'])
]

# Foreign keys
works_on.eid=employee.eid
works_on.projectid=projects.projectid

question: List the titles of books that are available in both 'Library A' and 'Library B'.
query: select t1.title from books as t1 join book_location as t2 on t1.isbn = t2.isbn join libraries as t3 on t3.libraryid = t2.libraryid where t3.libraryname = 'Library A' intersect select t1.title from books as t1 join book_location as t2 on t1.isbn = t2.isbn join libraries as t3 on t3.libraryid = t2.libraryid where t3.libraryname = 'Library B'
database:
# Table: books
[
(isbn:VARCHAR(13), Primary Key, Comment: ISBN number, Examples: ['978-3-16-148410-0', '978-0-13-468599-1']),
(title:VARCHAR(255), Comment: book title, Examples: ['The Great Gatsby', '1984']),
(author:VARCHAR(100), Comment: author name, Examples: ['F. Scott Fitzgerald', 'George Orwell']),
(year:INTEGER, Comment: publication year, Examples: [1925, 1949])
]

# Table: libraries
[
(libraryid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: library identifier, Examples: [1, 2]),
(libraryname:VARCHAR(255), Comment: library name, Examples: ['Library A', 'Library B']),
(location:VARCHAR(255), Comment: library location, Examples: ['Downtown', 'Uptown'])
]

# Table: book_location
[
(isbn:VARCHAR(13), Comment: ISBN number, Examples: ['978-3-16-148410-0', '978-0-13-468599-1']),
(libraryid:INTEGER, Comment: library identifier, Examples: [1, 2]),
(copies_available:INTEGER, Comment: number of available copies, Examples: [5, 3])
]

# Foreign keys
book_location.isbn=books.isbn
book_location.libraryid=libraries.libraryid

question: Find the names of customers who have purchased both 'Product X' and 'Product Y'.
query: select t1.name from customers as t1 join purchases as t2 on t1.cid = t2.cid join products as t3 on t3.productid = t2.productid where t3.productname = 'Product X' intersect select t1.name from customers as t1 join purchases as t2 on t1.cid = t2.cid join products as t3 on t3.productid = t2.productid where t3.productname = 'Product Y'
database:
# Table: customers
[
(cid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: customer id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(name:VARCHAR(30), Comment: customer name, Examples: [Alice, Bob]),
(email:VARCHAR(50), Comment: customer email, Examples: [alice@example.com, bob@example.com]),
(phone:VARCHAR(15), Comment: customer phone number, Examples: [1234567890, 9876543210]),
(address:VARCHAR(100), Comment: customer address, Examples: [123 Main St, 456 Elm St])
]

# Table: purchases
[
(cid:INTEGER, Comment: customer id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(productid:INTEGER, Comment: product id, Examples: [201, 202]),
(purchase_date:DATE, Comment: purchase date, Examples: [2023-01-01, 2023-01-05])
]

# Table: products
[
(productid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: product id, Examples: [201, 202]),
(productname:VARCHAR(50), Comment: product name, Examples: [Product X, Product Y]),
(price:REAL, Comment: product price, Examples: [19.99, 29.99]),
(stock:INTEGER, Comment: product stock, Examples: [100, 200])
]

# Foreign keys
purchases.cid=customers.cid
purchases.productid=products.productid

question: What are the employee names who work in both the IT and HR departments?
query: SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN department_employee AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN department AS T3 ON T3.did = T2.did WHERE T3.dept_name = 'IT' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN department_employee AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN department AS T3 ON T3.did = T2.did WHERE T3.dept_name = 'HR'
database:
# Table: employee
[
(eid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: employee id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(name:VARCHAR(50), Comment: employee name, Examples: [John Doe, Jane Smith]),
(age:INTEGER, Examples: [25, 30]),
(gender:VARCHAR(1), Examples: [M, F]),
(position:VARCHAR(50), Examples: [Developer, Manager]),
(salary:REAL, Examples: [50000, 60000])
]

# Table: department
[
(did:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: department id, Examples: [1, 2]),
(dept_name:VARCHAR(50), Comment: department name, Examples: [IT, HR]),
(location:VARCHAR(100), Examples: [Building A, Building B])
]

# Table: department_employee
[
(eid:INTEGER, Comment: employee id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(did:INTEGER, Comment: department id, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Foreign keys
department_employee.eid=employee.eid
department_employee.did=department.did

question: Which customers have purchased both laptops and smartphones?
query: SELECT T1.cname FROM customer AS T1 JOIN orders AS T2 ON T1.cid = T2.cid JOIN products AS T3 ON T3.pid = T2.pid WHERE T3ptype = 'laptop' INTERSECT SELECT T1.cname FROM customer AS T1 JOIN orders AS T2 ON T1.cid = T2.cid JOIN products AS T3 ON T3.pid = T2.pid WHERE T3ptype = 'smartphone'
database:
# Table: customer
[
(cid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: customer id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(cname:VARCHAR(30), Comment: customer name, Examples: [Alice, Bob]),
(email:VARCHAR(50), Comment: customer email, Examples: [alice@example.com, bob@example.com]),
(phone:VARCHAR(15), Comment: customer phone number, Examples: [1234567890, 0987654321]),
(address:VARCHAR(100), Comment: customer address, Examples: [123 Main St, 456 Elm St])
]

# Table: orders
[
(orderid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: order id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(cid:INTEGER, Comment: customer id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(pid:INTEGER, Comment: product id, Examples: [3001, 3002]),
(order_date:DATE, Comment: date of the order, Examples: ['2023-01-01', '2023-02-01']),
(quantity:INTEGER, Comment: quantity ordered, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: products
[
(pid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: product id, Examples: [3001, 3002]),
(pname:VARCHAR(50), Comment: product name, Examples: [Laptop A, Smartphone B]),
(ptype:VARCHAR(20), Comment: product type, Examples: [laptop, smartphone]),
(price:REAL, Comment: product price, Examples: [1200.00, 800.00]),
(stock:INTEGER, Comment: available stock, Examples: [10, 20])
]

# Foreign keys
orders.cid = customer.cid
orders.pid = products.pid

question: List the authors who have written both fiction and non-fiction books?
query: SELECT T1.aname FROM author AS T1 JOIN book_author AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid JOIN book AS T3 ON T3.bid = T2.bid WHERE T3.genre = 'fiction' INTERSECT SELECT T1.aname FROM author AS T1 JOIN book_author AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid JOIN book AS T3 ON T3.bid = T2.bid WHERE T3.genre = 'non-fiction'
database:
# Table: author
[
(aid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: author id, Examples: [1, 2]),
(aname:VARCHAR(50), Comment: author name, Examples: ['John Smith', 'Jane Doe']),
(bio:VARCHAR(255), Comment: author biography, Examples: ['Fiction writer', 'Non-fiction writer'])
]

# Table: book
[
(bid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: book id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(title:VARCHAR(100), Comment: book title, Examples: ['Fiction Title', 'Non-Fiction Title']),
(genre:VARCHAR(20), Comment: book genre, Examples: ['fiction', 'non-fiction']),
(pub_year:INTEGER, Comment: publication year, Examples: [2020, 2021])
]

# Table: book_author
[
(aid:INTEGER, Comment: author id, Examples: [1, 2]),
(bid:INTEGER, Comment: book id, Examples: [101, 102])
]

# Foreign keys
book_author.aid=author.aid
book_author.bid=book.bid

question: Retrieve the department and salary of employees who have never worked on a project based in New York.
query: SELECT department, salary FROM employees WHERE employee_id NOT IN (SELECT E1.employee_id FROM employees AS E1 JOIN works_on AS W ON E1.employee_id = W.employee_id JOIN projects AS P ON P.project_id = W.project_id WHERE P.location = 'New York')
database:
# Table: employees
[
(employee_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: employee id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(first_name:VARCHAR(20), Comment: first name, Examples: [John, Jane]),
(last_name:VARCHAR(20), Comment: last name, Examples: [Doe, Smith]),
(department:VARCHAR(50), Comment: department name, Examples: [Engineering, Marketing]),
(salary:DECIMAL, Comment: employee salary, Examples: [60000.00, 70000.00])
]

# Table: works_on
[
(employee_id:INTEGER, Comment: employee id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(project_id:INTEGER, Comment: project id, Examples: [201, 202])
]

# Table: projects
[
(project_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: project id, Examples: [201, 202]),
(project_name:VARCHAR(100), Comment: project name, Examples: [Project A, Project B]),
(location:VARCHAR(50), Comment: project location, Examples: [New York, San Francisco])
]

# Foreign keys
works_on.employee_id = employees.employee_id
works_on.project_id = projects.project_id

question: List the name and enrollment year of students who have not taken any mathematics courses.
query: SELECT name, enrollment_year FROM students WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT S1.student_id FROM students AS S1 JOIN takes AS T ON S1.student_id = T.student_id JOIN courses AS C ON C.course_id = T.course_id WHERE C.course_name LIKE '%Math%')
database:
# Table: students
[
(student_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: student id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(name:VARCHAR(30), Comment: student full name, Examples: [Alice Smith, Bob Johnson]),
(enrollment_year:INTEGER, Comment: year of enrollment, Examples: [2020, 2021]),
(age:INTEGER, Comment: student age, Examples: [19, 20])
]

# Table: takes
[
(student_id:INTEGER, Comment: student id, Examples: [101, 102]),
(course_id:INTEGER, Comment: course id, Examples: [201, 202])
]

# Table: courses
[
(course_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: course id, Examples: [201, 202]),
(course_name:VARCHAR(50), Comment: name of the course, Examples: [Calculus I, Introduction to Psychology]),
(credits:INTEGER, Comment: number of credits, Examples: [4, 3])
]

# Foreign keys
takes.student_id = students.student_id
takes.course_id = courses.course_id

question: Show the product category and price of items that have not been ordered by any customer from California.
query: SELECT category, price FROM products WHERE product_id NOT IN (SELECT P1.product_id FROM products AS P1 JOIN orders AS O ON P1.product_id = O.product_id JOIN customers AS C ON C.customer_id = O.customer_id WHERE C.state = 'California')
database:

[
(product_id: INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: product id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(name: VARCHAR(50), Comment: product name, Examples: [Laptop, Smartphone]),
(category: VARCHAR(30), Comment: product category, Examples: [Electronics, Accessories]),
(price: DECIMAL(10, 2), Comment: product price, Examples: [999.99, 199.99])
]

# Table: orders
[
(order_id: INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: order id, Examples: [5001, 5002]),
(customer_id: INTEGER, Comment: customer id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(product_id: INTEGER, Comment: product id, Examples: [1001, 1002]),
(order_date: DATE, Comment: date of the order, Examples: ['2023-01-01', '2023-01-02'])
]

# Table: customers
[
(customer_id: INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: customer id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(name: VARCHAR(50), Comment: customer name, Examples: [John Doe, Jane Smith]),
(state: VARCHAR(20), Comment: customer state, Examples: [California, Texas]),
(city: VARCHAR(30), Comment: customer city, Examples: [Los Angeles, Dallas])
]

# Foreign keys
orders.customer_id=customers.customer_id
orders.product_id=products.product_id

question: What department does each employee belong to who has never traveled abroad, and what is their salary?
query: SELECT department, salary FROM employee WHERE empid NOT IN (SELECT T1.empid FROM employee AS T1 JOIN travel_history AS T2 ON T1.empid = T2.empid WHERE T2.destination_country != 'USA')
database:
# Table: employee
[
(empid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: employee id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(lname:VARCHAR(12), Comment: last name, Examples: [Brown, Johnson]),
(fname:VARCHAR(12), Comment: first name, Examples: [Alice, Bob]),
(department:VARCHAR(20), Comment: department name, Examples: [IT, HR]),
(salary:REAL, Comment: salary amount, Examples: [60000, 75000]),
(city:VARCHAR(20), Comment: city of employment, Examples: [New York, San Francisco])
]

# Table: travel_history
[
(empid:INTEGER, Comment: employee id, Examples: [2001, 2002]),
(destination_country:VARCHAR(50), Comment: country traveled to, Examples: [France, Canada]),
(travel_date:DATE, Comment: date of travel, Examples: [2022-01-15, 2022-06-20])
]

# Foreign keys
travel_history.empid=employee.empid

question: What are the names and grades of all students who have not participated in any sports activities?

question: What are the titles and years of publication for books that have never been borrowed from the library?
query: SELECT title, year_published FROM books WHERE book_id NOT IN (SELECT T1.book_id FROM books AS T1 JOIN borrow_records AS T2 ON T1.book_id = T2.book_id)
database:
# Table: books
[
(book_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: book identifier, Examples: [101, 102]),
(title:VARCHAR(255), Comment: title of the book, Examples: [To Kill a Mockingbird, 1984]),
(author:VARCHAR(100), Comment: author of the book, Examples: [Harper Lee, George Orwell]),
(year_published:INTEGER, Comment: year the book was published, Examples: [1960, 1949]),
(genre:VARCHAR(50), Comment: genre of the book, Examples: [Fiction, Dystopian])
]

[
(record_id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Comment: record identifier, Examples: [1, 2]),

]

]

question: Which regions in Asia have at least 2 tech companies?
query: SELECT T1.RegionName FROM REGIONS AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent = T2.ContId JOIN TECH_COMPANIES AS T3 ON T1.RegionId = T3.Region WHERE T2.Continent = 'Asia' GROUP BY T1.RegionName HAVING count(*) >= 2;
database:
# Table: continents
[
(contid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(continent:TEXT, Examples: [america, asia, europe])
]

# Table: regions
[
(regionid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(regionname:TEXT, Examples: [southeast asia, east asia]),
(continent:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: tech_companies
[
(id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(companyname:TEXT, Examples: [company_a, company_b]),
(region:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: company_list
[
(companyid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(name:TEXT, Examples: [company_a, company_b]),
(region:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Table: company_data
[
(dataid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(revenue:REAL, Examples: [50000, 60000]),
(employees:INTEGER, Examples: [100, 200]),
(company:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

# Foreign keys
regions.continent=continents.contid
tech_companies.region=regions.regionid
company_list.region=regions.regionid
company_data.company=company_list.companyid

question: Which Asian countries have more than 5 car manufacturers?
query: SELECT T1.CountryName FROM COUNTRIES AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent = T2.ContId JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T3 ON T1.CountryId = T3.Country WHERE T2.Continent = 'asia' GROUP BY T1.CountryName HAVING count(*) > 5;
database:
# Table: continents
[
(contid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(continent:TEXT, Examples: [america, europe, asia])
]

# Table: countries
[
(countryid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(countryname:TEXT, Examples: [usa, germany, japan, china]),
(continent:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2, 3])  # continent refers to the contid in continents
]

# Table: car_makers
[
(id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(maker:TEXT, Examples: [ford, volkswagen, toyota, honda]),
(fullname:TEXT, Examples: [Ford Motor Company, Volkswagen AG, Toyota Motor Corporation]),
(country:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2, 3])  # country refers to the countryid in countries
]

# Table: model_list
[
(modelid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(maker:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2]),  # maker refers to the id in car_makers
(model:TEXT, Examples: [focus, golf, camry, accord])
]

# Table: car_names
[
(makeid:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(model:TEXT, Examples: [focus, golf, camry, accord]),
(make:TEXT, Examples: [ford, volkswagen, toyota, honda])  # make refers to the maker
]

# Table: cars_data
[
(id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(mpg:TEXT, Examples: [30, 25]),
(cylinders:INTEGER, Examples: [4, 6]),
(edispl:REAL, Examples: [2.0, 3.5]),
(horsepower:TEXT, Examples: [150, 170]),
(weight:INTEGER, Examples: [2900, 3200]),
(accelerate:REAL, Examples: [8.0, 7.5]),
(year:INTEGER, Examples: [2020, 2021])
]

# Foreign keys
countries.continent=continents.contid
car_makers.country=countries.countryid
model_list.maker=car_makers.id
car_names.model=model_list.model
cars_data.id=car_names.makeid

question: List all African countries that have exactly 2 electronics manufacturers.
query: SELECT T1.CountryName FROM COUNTRIES AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent = T2.ContId JOIN ELECTRONICS_MAKERS AS T3 ON T1.CountryId = T3.Country WHERE T2.Continent = 'africa' GROUP BY T1.CountryName HAVING count(*) = 2;

question: Identify North American countries with fewer than 4 pharmaceutical companies.
query: SELECT T1.CountryName FROM COUNTRIES AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent = T2.ContId JOIN PHARMA_COMPANIES AS T3 ON T1.CountryId = T3.Country WHERE T2.Continent = 'north america' GROUP BY T1.CountryName HAVING count(*) < 4;

(continent:INTEGER, Examples: [1, 2])
]

(id:INTEGER, Primary Key, Examples: [1, 2]),
(company_name:TEXT, Examples: [pfizer, moderna]),

question: What are the unique types of engines used in vehicles that have a horsepower greater than 200 but are not manufactured by General Motors?

question: Which authors have written at least 3 books and more than 5 articles? List the author ID and name.

question: What are the ids and publishers of all book publishers that publish at least 5 titles and have more than 7 books in circulation?
query: SELECT T1.Id, T1.Publisher FROM BOOK_PUBLISHERS AS T1 JOIN TITLE_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id = T2.Publisher GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*) >= 5 INTERSECT SELECT T1.Id, T1.Publisher FROM BOOK_PUBLISHERS AS T1 JOIN TITLE_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id = T2.Publisher JOIN CIRCULATION_BOOKS AS T3 ON T2.TitleId = T3.TitleId GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*) > 7;

query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Name FROM habitat AS T1 JOIN animal AS T2 ON T2.HabitatID = T1.ID WHERE T1.Name = 'African Savanna' AND T2.Name NOT IN (SELECT T3.Name FROM animal AS T3 JOIN classification AS T4 ON T3.ID = T4.AnimalID WHERE T4.IsMammal = 'T')

]
